detaileddescription.para:
Default style modifier function
group
pointer to the caller group
style
pointer to a style to modify. (Typically group.style_tmp) It will be OVERWRITTEN.

group
pointer to the caller group

pointer to a style to modify. (Typically group.style_tmp) It will be OVERWRITTEN.

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_group_t *group, void *(*begin)(const lv_ll_t *), void *(*move)(const lv_ll_t *, const void *))
memberdef.name: focus_next_core

detaileddescription.para: Init. the group module

Create a new object group
pointer to the new object group

Delete a group object
group
pointer to a group

Add an object to a group
group
pointer to a group
obj
pointer to an object to add

Remove an object from its group
obj
pointer to an object to remove

Remove all objects from a group
group
pointer to a group

Focus on an object (defocus the current)
obj
pointer to an object to focus on

Focus the next object in a group (defocus the current)
group
pointer to a group

Focus the previous object in a group (defocus the current)
group
pointer to a group

Do not let to change the focus from the current object
group
pointer to a group
en
true: freeze, false: release freezing (normal mode)

Send a control character to the focuses object of a group
group
pointer to a group
c
a character (use LV_KEY_.. to navigate)
result of focused object in group.

Set a function for a group which will modify the object's style if it is in focus
group
pointer to a group
style_mod_cb
the style modifier function pointer

Set a function for a group which will modify the object's style if it is in focus in edit mode
group
pointer to a group
style_mod_func
the style modifier function pointer

Set a function for a group which will be called when a new object is focused
group
pointer to a group
focus_cb
the call back function or NULL if unused

Manually set the current mode (edit or navigate).
group
pointer to group
edit
true: edit mode; false: navigate mode

Set the click_focus attribute. If enabled then the object will be focused then it is clicked.
group
pointer to group
en
true: enable click_focus

Set whether the next or previous item in a group is focused if the currently focussed obj is deleted.
group
pointer to a group
new
refocus policy enum

Set whether focus next/prev will allow wrapping from first->last or last->first.
group
pointer to group
en
true: enable wrap

Modify a style with the set 'style_mod' function. The input style remains unchanged.
group
pointer to group
style
pointer to a style to modify
a copy of the input style but modified with the 'style_mod' function

Get the focused object or NULL if there isn't one
group
pointer to a group
pointer to the focused object

Get a pointer to the group's user data
group
pointer to an group
pointer to the user data

Get a the style modifier function of a group
group
pointer to a group
pointer to the style modifier function

Get a the style modifier function of a group in edit mode
group
pointer to a group
pointer to the style modifier function

Get the focus callback function of a group
group
pointer to a group
the call back function or NULL if not set

Get the current mode (edit or navigate).
group
pointer to group
true: edit mode; false: navigate mode

Get the click_focus attribute.
group
pointer to group
true: click_focus is enabled; false: disabled

Get whether focus next/prev will allow wrapping from first->last or last->first object.
group
pointer to group
en
true: wrapping enabled; false: wrapping disabled

Notify the group that current theme changed and style modification callbacks need to be refreshed.
group
pointer to group. If NULL then all groups are notified.
